subject: Travel
subcategory: The Story of Maps and Navigation
title: Navigation for the Blind
description: A fast breakdown of Navigation for the Blind for builders.

hook.text: For visually impaired people, crossing a city is a daily act of navigation most sighted people never consider.

buildup.text: Apps like Soundscape and Lazarillo use GPS and spatial audio to describe surroundings through earbuds.

discovery.text: 3D audio places sounds in space. A cafÃ© to your left is heard from the left, a park ahead from in front.

twist.text: AI-powered camera apps can now read signs, identify objects, and describe street scenes in real time.

climax.text: Smart cane prototypes use ultrasonic sensors and haptic feedback to warn of obstacles before contact.

punchline.text: Technology is turning the world into an audio map.

quiz.question: How do navigation apps for the blind use spatial audio?
options: Sounds are placed directionally to describe surroundings
